item.title: Cut video on a linux terminal
item.description: If you want to cut a video but you don’t want to open a video editor, you can use a terminal utility called “ffmpeg”. On Debian/Ubuntu based systems we can install it with: sudo apt install ffmpeg Now we can use the following command to cut a video: ffmpeg -i input.mp4 -ss 01:29:23 -to 01:35:02 -c copy output.mp4 Explanation # With “ffmpeg -i input.mp4” we say we want to use the video called “input.
